page.title: 03ST JOHN THE BAPIST-BAGINTON
page.content: "Festival 700" celebrating the seventh centenary of the church's foundation has been held this year with a variety of festivals and social events. This church is very closely involved in the community through the play scheme, women's institute, youth and senior citizen's clubs. Listed in the Domesday Book the church of "Badechitone" it retains its original character with additions and restoration work in keeping with a medieval church. Only the electric lighting seems incongruous. The spire repaired in 1982 has stone taken from Baginton castle. Some rebuilding during the 1930's and '40's was necessitated by the ravages of wartime bombing. Like many parish churches the vicar is shared with nearby villages holding regular Thursday and Sunday services.
